174.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a one-time payment of $3,200 for contract soldiers and those who have been mobilised to fight in Ukraine, the Kremlin said on Thursday. The payment was designed "to provide additional measures of social support", Putin said in a decree.  The minimum monthly wage for contract soldiers is $2,700, almost three times the national average.

175.title: Udaan to begin 2nd round of layoffs amid operation overhaul: Report
175.article_body: B2B e-commerce startup Udaan will fire some contractual workers and sales supervisors in the second round of layoffs as it revamps its operations, Financial Express reported. This comes a week after Udaan secured $120 million in funding through convertible notes and debt from existing investors and bondholders. In June, the unicorn laid off about 180 employees citing changing market conditions.

176.title: Which Indian states have the highest unemployment rate & which have the lowest?
176.article_body: Haryana had the highest unemployment rate of 31.8% among Indian states in the month of October, as per latest data from CMIE. It was followed by Rajasthan (30.7%), Jammu & Kashmir (22.4%), Jharkhand (16.5%), and Bihar (14.5%). Meanwhile, the states that had the lowest unemployment rates were Madhya Pradesh (0.8%), Chhattisgarh (0.9%), Odisha (1.1%), Gujarat (1.7%), and Karnataka (2.7%).

177.title: Teen found hanging in J'khand police station, officer-in-charge suspended
177.article_body: The officer-in-charge of a police station in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district has been suspended after an 18-year-old youth was found hanging inside a cell within the campus of the station. The deceased allegedly used his belt to hang himself to death, police said. The deceased was taken into custody recently for interrogation after he allegedly eloped with a minor girl.

178.title: Time to welcome Finland, Sweden to NATO: Stoltenberg to Turkish minister
178.article_body: Jens Stoltenberg, NATO Secretary-General, has urged Turkey to approve Sweden and Finland's applications to join the military alliance. Stoltenberg said the two Nordic nations had delivered on Turkey's demands and were ready to join NATO. Meanwhile, Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu said Sweden and Finland have not yet fulfilled obligations under a deal to clear their bids.

179.title: Work from home announced for 50% Delhi govt employees amid high pollution levels
179.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Friday announced that 50 per cent of Delhi government employees will be working from home amid high pollution levels in the city. Earlier today, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced the closure of primary schools in the national capital from Saturday. The schools in the city will remain closed till the pollution situation improves.

180.title: India's unemployment rate rises to 7.77% in Oct from 6.43% in Sept: CMIE
180.article_body: India's unemployment rate surged to 7.77% in October, according to the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE). It had touched a four-year low of 6.43% in September. The rise was led by an increase in the rural joblessness rate to 8.04% in October as against 5.84% in September after the kharif harvest season, while urban joblessness rate fell to 7.21%.

181.title: 66% schools didn't have internet access in 2021-22 academic year: Report
181.article_body: A report by the Ministry of Education stated that at least 55.5% of schools in the country did not have computer facilities, and 66% were without internet access in the 2021-22 academic year. According to the report, only 2.2% of the schools had digital libraries and only 14.9% of them had smart classrooms, used for virtual teaching.

182.title: NZ defeat Ireland in their last T20 WC 2022 Super 12 match, take their NRR to +2.113
182.article_body: New Zealand defeated Ireland by 35 runs in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. With this, they extended their lead at the top of the Group 1 points table with seven points and a net run-rate (NRR) of +2.113. Meanwhile, Ireland finished their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign with three points in the Super 12 stage.

183.title: Committed to addressing concerns: Lupin on USFDA warning for Tarapur plant
183.article_body: After the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) sent a warning letter to Lupin over manufacturing errors at Maharashtra's Tarapur plant, the drugmaker said, "We are committed to addressing the concerns raised by the USFDA and will work with the USFDA to resolve these issues at the earliest." It added that this wouldn't disrupt the plant's supplies or existing revenue.

184.title: King Charles had a valet for his teddy when he was in his 40s, book claims
184.article_body: UK's King Charles III was so attached to his childhood teddy bear that he had a person to look after it in his forties, according to a new book. A former nanny to the royal family was called out of retirement for its maintenance, a former valet claimed in the book titled 'The King: The Life of Charles III'.

185.title: Tihar DG Sandeep Goel transferred days after Sukesh Chandrashekar's ₹12.50 cr bribe claim
185.article_body: Days after conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar alleged that he paid ₹12.50 crore as a bribe to Tihar DG Sandeep Goel, the officer has been transferred. Delhi LG Vinai Kumar Saxena on Friday issued transfer orders for Goel. IPS Sanjay Beniwal has been appointed as the new DG of Prisons. A copy of the transfer issue surfaced online.

186.title: China & Germany should cooperate in times of turmoil: Xi tells Scholz
186.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping told German Chancellor Olaf Scholz that China and Germany should work together during "times of change and turmoil", a Chinese state broadcaster reported. During his one-day visit to China, Scholz held his first face-to-face meeting with Xi since taking office. Scholz reportedly said the Russian invasion of Ukraine was creating problems for the rule-based global order.

187.title: South Korea sends fighter jets after detecting 180 North Korean warplanes near border
187.article_body: South Korea has said that it has scrambled its fighter jets after detecting 180 North Korean warplanes near its border. South Korea scrambled 80 aircraft, including, F-35A stealth fighters, in response. About 240 aircraft participating in the Vigilant Storm air exercises with the United States continued the drills, the military said.

188.title: Urvashi Dholakia shares her pics, says 'Our bodies change with each passing day'
188.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia shared her pictures on Instagram and wrote, "From time unknown, women have been judged! From how they look, to what they wear & how they behave...I as a woman have all the right to be myself." "Our bodies change each passing day & we don't need to be judged for our shapes & sizes," she added.

189.title: Telangana CM KCR releases videos to back poaching charges against BJP
189.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Thursday released video clips to back poaching charges against the BJP. One of the videos shows the 'deal' between agents who were allegedly trying to lure four Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) MLAs to join the BJP. In the video, one of the accused Satish Sharma can be heard offering ₹50 crore each to MLAs.

190.title: Twitter sued over plan to fire 50% workforce without enough notice: Report
190.article_body: Twitter has been sued over a plan to eliminate half of its workforce, about 3,700 jobs, after Elon Musk took control of the company, Bloomberg reported. Employees alleged that Twitter is violating federal and California law by firing them without giving enough notice. Twitter will start laying off staff on Friday and has temporarily shut offices and suspended badge access.

191.title: HPCL stock falls by 4%, nears 52-week low after quarterly loss
191.article_body: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited's shares (HPCL) fell by almost 4% on Friday after the company posted a standalone net loss of ₹2,172 crore for the September quarter as against a profit of ₹1,923.5 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. It saw its worst fall in over a month and neared its 52-week low of ₹200.05 apiece on the NSE.

192.title: 19-year-old woman found dead at home in Ghaziabad, 2 brothers detained
192.article_body: Police detained two brothers of a 19-year-old woman after she was found dead at her home on Wednesday in Ghaziabad. The two admitted to killing her over her relationship with a 25-year-old man they did not approve of, police said. Notably, two audio clips, one in which the woman could be heard seeking help from her male friend, surfaced online.

193.title: Starbucks Co-founder tries filter coffee, masala dosa in B'luru, restaurant shares pics
193.article_body: Starbucks Co-founder Zev Siegl visited the famous Vidyarthi Bhavan restaurant in Bengaluru on Thursday. The restaurant took to social media to share pictures of Siegl enjoying their filter coffee and masala dosa. "It is an honour to enjoy your famous food, coffee...I will take this wonderful experience with me back to Seattle," Siegl wrote in the restaurant's guest book.

194.title: ED raids 12 places in WB, J'khand in illegal land grabbing case: Reports
194.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday raided nearly 12 places in West Bengal and Jharkhand in a money laundering case against those illegally occupying Indian Army lands, as per reports. The places where searches were conducted included the premises of a Kolkata-based businessman Amit Agrawal, reports added. Notably, ED arrested Agrawal last month in connection with a money laundering case.

195.title: 33-year-old employee dies after getting locked inside walk-in freezer in US bakery
195.article_body: A 33-year-old bakery employee has been found dead inside a walk-in freezer in US' New York after he allegedly got locked inside accidentally. The man reportedly got trapped while cleaning out the freezer in the early hours. "We are devastated by the loss of our employee in this accident...We extended our deepest condolences to [the family]," the bakery's manager said.

196.title: Amara Raja Batteries' stock surges most in a decade after Q2 results
196.article_body: Amara Raja Batteries' shares increased the most in a decade after the company reported a 39% year-on-year rise in consolidated profit for the September quarter. The company's board has also approved an interim dividend of ₹2.90/share and the record date for the same has been set for November 16. At 11:29 am, its stock was trading 10.58% higher on BSE.

197.title: Illegal parking lot busted in Gurugram's DLF Phase-2; 4 arrested
197.article_body: Gurugram Police and the CM's flying squad arrested four people for allegedly running an illegal parking lot on a municipal corporation's plot near the Rapid Metro station in DLF Phase-2. The police said that they are conducting raids to arrest the kingpins who have been running the parking lot illegally for the last three years.

198.title: We take responsibility for stubble burning in Punjab: Kejriwal and Mann on pollution
198.article_body: Amid high pollution level, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann held a joint press conference and said, "We take responsibility for the stubble burning in Punjab." Adding that this is not the time for "blame game", Kejriwal stated, "We have taken steps to control it. Stubble burning will come down by next year."

199.title: India gifts 80 vehicles to Nepal for upcoming election
199.article_body: Extending logistical support to Nepal for the conduct of the November 20 election, India on Thursday gifted 80 vehicles to Kathmandu's Election Commission. "These 80 vehicles are part of the 200 vehicles that have been provided to Nepal, at their request," Indian Embassy in Kathmandu said. "The handing over of...vehicles is reflective of close...relationship between India and Nepal," it added.

200.title: 6 local trains cancelled, 70 delayed due to technical snag in Mumbai
200.article_body: The Western Railway's suburban service was disrupted this morning due to a technical snag in Mumbai. At least six local trains were cancelled and at least 70 were delayed. Six long-distance trains were also delayed by about 30 minutes. "All...fast suburban locals are running late by 15-20 minutes. Inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," Western Railway's Mumbai division tweeted.

201.title: Pak police officers suspended for leaking confession of Imran Khan's attacker
201.article_body: Chief Minister of Pakistan's Punjab province Chaudhry Elahi has suspended police officers and other officials for leaking the confession of the suspect who shot at ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad. In a confession video, the suspect can be heard saying he "wanted to kill only Imran Khan and no one else" because "he was misleading people".

202.title: Man kicks 6-yr-old in the chest for leaning on his car in Kerala; arrested
202.article_body: A man has been arrested after a video showing him kicking a six-year-old boy in the chest for leaning on his car went viral on social media. Police has registered a case against the man, Shihshad, a resident of Ponnyampalam. Assembly Speaker AN Shamseer said stringent action would be taken against the accused.

203.title: Ireland's Josh Little breaks world record for taking most T20I wickets in a single year
203.article_body: Ireland's 23-year-old fast bowler Josh Little has broken the world record for taking most wickets in T20I cricket in a calendar year. With his hat-trick against New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2022 on Friday, Little took his tally of wickets in T20I cricket in 2022 to 39. He overtook Nepal's Sandeep Lamichhane, who has taken 38 wickets in 2022.

204.title: Reliance in talks to buy 49% stake in Naturals Salon & Spa: Report
204.article_body: The retail arm of Reliance Industries, Reliance Retail, is looking to enter the salon business by buying a 49% stake in the Chennai-based Groom India Salon & Spa, the Naturals Salon & Spa parent, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Confirming the development, CEO of Naturals Salon & Spa CK Kumaravel said that the negotiations are at a 'nascent stage'.

205.title: Delhi primary schools to be shut from tomorrow amid high pollution levels
205.article_body: Primary schools in Delhi will remain shut from tomorrow amid high pollution levels in the national capital, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced on Friday. Schools will remain closed till pollution situation in national capital improves. Schools in Noida and Greater Noida also decided to hold online classes for students of Classes 1-8 till November 8 in view of rising pollution.

206.title: Ireland become first team to produce 2 hat-tricks in T20 World Cup history
206.article_body: Ireland have became the first team to produce two hat-tricks in T20 World Cup history. Ireland's 23-year-old pacer Josh Little dismissed New Zealand's Kane Williamson, Jimmy Neesham and Mitchell Santner on Friday to take Ireland's second hat-trick in T20 World Cup history. Curtis Campher was the first Irish bowler to take a T20 World Cup hat-trick.

207.title: Apple starts manufacturing iPhone 14 at a second plant in India: Report
207.article_body: Apple's Taiwanese contract manufacturer Pegatron has begun assembling the new iPhone 14 in India, Bloomberg reported. The move makes Pegatron the second Apple supplier to manufacture the iPhone 14 in India, months after Foxconn started its production near Chennai. Notably, the world's largest iPhone plant situated in China's Zhengzhou was recently placed under lockdown after COVID-19 outbreak.

208.title: Sushmita Sen told me if I'm happy without Rajeev, I should separate: Sister-in-law Charu
208.article_body: After initiating divorce proceedings again against Rajeev Sen, actress Charu Asopa said that her sister-in-law Sushmita Sen has always told her to prioritise her own happiness. "She (Sushmita) has said that if I'm happier with Rajeev, then that's what I should do, but if I'm happier away from him, then I should separate," Charu said.

209.title: Apple halts hiring for roles outside R&D to cut costs: Report
209.article_body: Apple has paused hiring for several jobs outside of research and development under its plan to cut costs, Bloomberg reported. It made the decision to freeze hiring last month ahead of its quarterly earnings report. Apple said it continues to hire but given the current economic environment it's taking "a very deliberate approach" in some parts of the business.

210.title: Morbi Nagar Palika chief officer suspended over bridge collapse: Reports
210.article_body: The chief officer of Gujarat's Morbi Nagar Palika Sandipsinh Zala has reportedly been suspended following the Morbi bridge collapse incident that killed 135 persons. Police have arrested nine persons in connection with the incident so far. An Oreva Group manager, Deepak Parekh, who is among those arrested earlier said it was "the will of God" that the incident took place.

211.title: 6 health workers terminated after dog licks blood of patient in UP hospital
211.article_body: Services of six health workers were terminated after a video of a dog licking the blood of a patient in a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kushinagar went viral. Reports said that Kushinagar district magistrate, S Raj Lingam, issued the termination orders. Lingam also sought an explanation from the chief medical superintendent and two medical officers.

212.title: 5-day search operation after Morbi suspension bridge collapse called off
212.article_body: The Gujarat government has called off the five-day search operation that was launched after the collapse of the suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi. More than 130 people lost their lives in the incident. State Commissioner of Relief Harshad Patel visited Morbi and announced the end of the search operation, reports said.

213.title: Morgan Stanley to begin layoffs in coming weeks globally: Report
213.article_body: Morgan Stanley is expected to begin a fresh round of layoffs globally in coming weeks, Reuters reported citing people familiar with the plan. In Asia Pacific, the bank has reportedly drafted a list of staff members considered redundant, who mainly work with teams that focus on China-related business. The bank is yet to decide on scale and timing of layoffs.

214.title: When India play, there is a lot of pressure on ICC: Afridi on India-Bangladesh match
214.article_body: Talking about rain-curtailed India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 match, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi stated that there is a lot of pressure on ICC when India play. "Given the amount of rain that happened, the game resumed immediately after the break...India's pressure on ICC is evident," Afridi stated. "There are many factors involved," Afridi further said.

215.title: US embassy officials visit basketball player Griner in Russian prison
215.article_body: Officials from the US embassy in Moscow met detained US basketball player Brittney Griner on Thursday. The officials "saw firsthand her tenacity and perseverance despite her present circumstances", US State Department spokesman Ned Price said, adding that US would continue to push for her release. Last week, a Russian court rejected Griner's appeal of her nine-year sentence for drug possession.

216.title: Nuclear attack on US will result in end of Kim Jong-un's regime: US
216.article_body: After repeated missile launches by North Korea, US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said, "Any nuclear attack against the United States or its allies and partners, including the use of non-strategic nuclear weapons, is unacceptable." "It will result in the end of the Kim regime," he further said. North Korea launched over 20 missiles on Wednesday.

217.title: Are we thieves, murderers; don't we have engagements: Soren on ED summons
217.article_body: While speaking about the summons issued to him by the Enforcement Directorate, Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren asked, "Do you think we are 'chor-uchakke' (thieves) or 'hatyare' (murderers)? They issued the summons yesterday (Wednesday) and asked me to appear today (Thursday)." "Don't we have our engagements?" he further asked while saying that he was already invited to an event.

218.title: Twitter down for several users in India
218.article_body: Twitter was down for several users in India on Friday morning, with many reporting that they were unable to log into the website. A popup saying, "Something went wrong, but don't worry-try again", was shown to users trying to access the site. Notably, the outage was reported hours after news broke that Twitter will start laying off staff today.

219.title: Cong promises up to 300 units of free electricity ahead of Gujarat polls
219.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge announced 10 promises, including subsidised or free services in the health care, farm and electricity sectors. "LPG cylinders for ₹500, free electricity for up to 300 units, free treatment and medicines up to ₹10 lakh, loan waivers for up to ₹3 lakh for farmers," said Kharge.

220.title: Amazon pauses hiring in corporate workforce for the next few months
220.article_body: Amazon is pausing corporate workforce hiring as the e-commerce firm deals with an "unusual macro-economic environment", Beth Galetti, Senior Vice-president of People Experience and Technology, said. "We anticipate keeping this pause in place for the next few months...will continue to monitor what we're seeing in the economy and the business to adjust as we think makes sense," she added.

221.title: French Parliament suspended as MP shouts 'Go back to Africa' at black MP
221.article_body: France's lower house of Parliament was suspended on Thursday after a far-right MP shouted, "Go back to Africa!" as a Black legislator talked about immigration. Grégoire de Fournas later said his remark wasn't aimed at MP Carlos Bilongo but at migrants trying to reach Europe by sea. "There's no room for racism in our democracy," French PM Elisabeth Borne said.

222.title: 22,500-kg part of Chinese rocket, the size of 10-storey building, likely to crash on Earth
222.article_body: A 22,500-kg part of China's Long March 5B rocket is expected to crash on Earth either on Friday or Saturday, with uncertainty about where exactly it will land, according to the Aerospace Corporation. The part is said to be about the size of a 10-storey building. "The uncertainty of where the large debris will ultimately land presents...risk," it stated.

223.title: Woman, daughter among 3 dead as car falls into well in Maharashtra
223.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her eight-year-old daughter were among the three persons who died as their car fell into an old open well in Maharashtra's Buldhana, police said. The woman was driving and her husband and their daughter were with her, police added. He managed to come out safely and another man who tried to rescue them died, police stated.

224.title: Platform ticket prices reduced from ₹50 to ₹10 by Northern Railway
224.article_body: Northern Railway has rolled back the platform ticket prices that were increased to ₹50 due to Diwali and Chhath Puja. The platform ticket will now be available for ₹10, as before. "The rates of platform tickets at a total of 14 railway stations have been reduced…Tickets became cheaper at Lucknow, Varanasi, Barabanki, Ayodhya Cantt…Unnao," said the DCM of Northern Railway.

225.title: Ex-Andhra minister, son arrested for allegedly forging document
225.article_body: Former Andhra Pradesh minister and Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Ayyanna Patrudu and his son were arrested for allegedly forging a document, which was submitted to the High Court, related to encroachment of an irrigation canal land. Patrudu and his son were arrested from their residence in Narsipatnam. Patrudu's wife criticised the government for arresting the duo without prior information.

226.title: US-based Apiiro raises $100 mn in a round led by General Catalyst
226.article_body: US-based applications security startup Apiiro has secured $100 million in Series B funding round led by General Catalyst. The round saw participation from Greylock and Kleiner Perkins. The funding comes weeks after Globes reported that cybersecurity firm Palo Alto Networks was interested in buying Apiiro for around $550 million. In October 2020, Apiiro raised $35 million in Series A round.

227.title: Mumbai local train bumps into buffer while stopping at station, probe on
227.article_body: A local train in Mumbai bumped into a buffer while coming to halt at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) on Thursday. Reports said that no injury was reported in the incident. A Central Railway official said that an inquiry into the matter has been initiated to ascertain the exact cause of the incident.

228.title: Elon Musk removes 'Days of Rest' from Twitter employees' calendars: Reports
228.article_body: Elon Musk has removed 'Days of Rest' from Twitter employees' calendars for the rest of the year, as per reports. The monthly, company-wide day off was introduced at Twitter during the COVID-19 pandemic period to help reduce burnout. Meanwhile, Musk is reportedly planning to end the work from anywhere policy for Twitter staff who will not be affected by layoffs.

229.title: Balewadi residents launch campaign against Pune Smart City
229.article_body: A residency cooperative housing federation in Pune's Balewadi has launched a campaign against Pune Smart City Development Corporation Limited (PSCDCL) for being deprived of basic citizens' rights like water, roads, etc. "We're willing to hold a meeting with the residents...but we have...implemented projects such as...Balewadi road redesign...and LED street lights," PSCDCL CEO said.

230.title: Fire at warehouse in Pune as 10 LPG cylinders explode, no casualties
230.article_body: A major fire broke out at a private warehouse, full of plastic material and other scrap items, as about 10 LPG cylinders exploded in Vadgaonsheri's Sopan Nagar on the Pune-Ahmednagar Highway on Thursday. No casualties were reported in the incident. As many as 15 fire tenders along with eight fire officers and 60 firemen were rushed to the site.

231.title: India comments on Elon Musk's plan to charge $8/month for Twitter blue tick
231.article_body: Commenting on Elon Musk's plan to charge $8 per month for Twitter blue tick, Ministry of External Affairs' Official Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "We are not aware of the process of paid subscription." "We will take a decision based on the contours of this subscription service as and when it happens," he further said.

232.title: Twitter fired me after I made software to save emails, shared it with others: Engineer
232.article_body: A former Twitter engineer claimed that he was fired after he made a browser extension that helped download important emails and documents and shared it with his colleagues amid rumours about layoffs at the company. "My current understanding is...I was too much of a potential troublemaker for the new management," Emmanuel Cornet said speculating his reasons for being laid off.

233.title: Cheerios maker, Audi of America halt ads on Twitter after Musk takeover
233.article_body: After General Motors, Cheerios maker General Mills and luxury automaker Audi of America have paused advertising on Twitter following Tesla CEO Elon Musk taking over the social media company last week. "We will continue to monitor this new direction and evaluate our marketing spend," a General Mills spokesperson said. Audi of America said it would "continue to evaluate the situation".

234.title: 65% of Indian companies employed gig workers in 2022: Report
234.article_body: Almost 65% of Indian companies employed gig workers in 2022, a report by trade body NASSCOM, job portal Indeed and financial services firm AON showed. The report mentioned that share of companies (with more than 2,000 full-time employees) hiring gig workers has increased, but their proportion remains less than 5% of total workforce. In 2020, 57% companies employed gig workers.

235.title: Gangster Ejaz Lakdawala takes bottle of mosquitoes to Mumbai court to seek nets in jail
235.article_body: Gangster Ejaz Lakdawala, who is an undertrial at Taloja Central Jail, arrived at the Mumbai sessions court with a bottle filled with mosquitoes to seek access to mosquito nets. However, his plea was rejected as prison officials raised the issue of security, stating that nails and strings used for setting up the mosquito nets could pose safety concerns.

236.title: Cab driver beaten up in Delhi then left tied up in Gurugram; 4 held
236.article_body: Four people were arrested after a cab driver was allegedly beaten up and robbed in Delhi and then left tied up with a blindfold in Gurugram's Manesar. The accused had apparently hailed the victim's cab. "At Zakhira flyover, one of the accused got down on...pretext of urinating. The others tried to strangle...driver and pushed him in...back seat," an officer said.

237.title: 4.5 mn left without electricity after Russia's attacks: Ukraine Prez
237.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said about 4.5 million people have been temporarily left without electricity due to Russian attacks. "The very fact that Russia resorted to terror against the energy industry shows the weakness of the enemy. They cannot defeat Ukraine on the battlefield, and that's why they're trying to break our people in this way," he added.

238.title: Tiger Global halts new investments in Chinese equities: Report
238.article_body: Tiger Global Management has halted investments in Chinese equities even as it reassesses its exposure to the country after President Xi Jinping entered into his third term of power, The Wall Street Journal reported. The executives of the investment firm have reportedly said that geopolitical tensions could increase after Xi's re-election and China's zero-COVID-19 policy is likely to continue.

239.title: What will be affected as Delhi implements stage 4 of pollution action plan?
239.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management has decided to implement measures under stage 4 of Graded Response Action Plan in Delhi-NCR. Under this, the entry of trucks other than electric and CNG, except those carrying essential commodities, will be banned. Four-wheeled diesel light motor vehicles, except BS-VI vehicles, will be banned. The construction work will also be restricted in Delhi-NCR.

240.title: 11 people killed as bus collides with car in Madhya Pradesh's Betul
240.article_body: As many as 11 people were killed in Madhya Pradesh's Betul after a bus collided with a car. The accident took place near the Jhallar police station. One person who was injured in the accident has been admitted to a hospital, SP Betul Simala Prasad told news agency ANI. A picture from accident site showed damaged car on the road.

241.title: Former Israel PM Netanyahu wins general election; PM Modi congratulates him
241.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday congratulated former Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu for his win in the general election. "Congratulations my friend Netanyahu on your success...I look forward to continuing our joint efforts to deepen the strategic partnership between India and Israel," PM Modi tweeted. This was Israel's fifth general election in less than four years.

242.title: 3 K'taka sisters enter lake to save their 14-yr-old brother, all 4 drown
242.article_body: Three sisters drowned while trying to save their 14-year-old brother from drowning in a lake in Vijayanagara district of Karnataka. The incident took place on Wednesday. The deceased have been identified as 17-year-old Ashwini, 14-year-old Abhishek, 19-year-old Kavya and 14-year-old Apoorva. Abhishek had fallen into the lake accidentally. His elder sister then jumped into the lake to save him.

243.title: Delhi's air quality 'severe' with 472 AQI; Noida's AQI at 562
243.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Friday morning was recorded as 'severe' with an air quality index (AQI) of 472. The AQI in Uttar Pradesh's Noida also stood in the 'severe' category at 562, while in Gurugram it stood at 539. An AQI of 563 was recorded on Friday morning near the Delhi University area.

244.title: Violence has no place in politics: US on Imran Khan assassination attempt
244.article_body: The US condemned the assassination attempt on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad. "Violence has no place in politics, and we call on all parties to refrain from violence...and intimidation," US State Secretary Antony Blinken said. The suspect who shot at Khan confessed that he wanted to "kill" the former premier "because he was misleading people".

245.title: If you are on your way to office, please go home: Twitter tells staff amid layoffs
245.article_body: Twitter will start laying off employees on Friday, a week after Elon Musk acquired the company. "If you are in an office or on your way to an office, please return home," Twitter wrote in an email to its staff. Employees who are being laid off will be notified with the next steps on their personal email accounts, Twitter said.

246.title: Layoffs to start on Friday: Twitter in email to staff
246.article_body: Twitter will alert employees on Friday about whether they will be laid off, the company said in an email to staff. The social media platform said in the email that its offices will be temporarily closed and all badge access will be suspended in order "to help ensure safety of each employee as well as Twitter systems and customer data".

247.title: 1-day old baby among 487 kids rescued under 'Operation Reunite' in Mumbai
247.article_body: The Mumbai Police have rescued 487 missing or abducted children in 45 days, from August 15 to September 30, under 'Operation Reunite'. Among those rescued are a one-day-old baby and a one-year-old girl. Out of the total, 257 girls and 230 boys have been rescued, Commissioner of Police (CP) Vivek Phansalkar, who had launched the operation, said.

248.title: Musk directs Twitter to cut infrastructure costs by $1 bn: Report
248.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has ordered teams at Twitter to find up to $1 billion in annual infrastructure cost savings, Reuters reported citing sources and an internal Slack message. The teams have a November 7 deadline to present their cost savings plans. Some employees have been ordered to work in the office throughout the week to meet the deadline.

249.title: Mumbai's Gokhale bridge declared unsafe, may be shut for traffic from Mon
249.article_body: Gopal Krishna Gokhale bridge in Mumbai's Andheri has been declared unsafe by a consultancy firm hired by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and may be shut for vehicular traffic from Monday. The firm said bridge's elements like RCC columns and girders have lost their strength due to corrosion. BMC has requested Mumbai Traffic Police to work on alternative route for motorists.

250.title: Couple fills pothole with soil on B'luru road after 'narrowly escaping death'
250.article_body: A couple filled up a pothole with soil after they apparently 'narrowly escaped death' in Bengaluru's Malleshwaram, a Twitter handle that shared the clip of the incident claimed. "This is [the] state of #NammaBengaluru roads...wake up," the tweet by @SpeakUpBengalur, which tagged BBMP Commissioner and CM Basavaraj Bommai, read. At least three people died due to potholes in Bengaluru recently.

251.title: Will solve problems faced by offices on Bengaluru's ORR: Minister
251.article_body: Bengaluru's civic body will hold a meeting on November 14 and examine the situation of the Outer Ring Road, minister CN Ashwath Narayan has said. The assurance came after the civic body received complaints from companies that have office spaces on Outer Ring Road and from residents who live there. Narayan also said service roads in Bengaluru will be upgraded.

252.title: Gerard Piqué announces retirement from football after 14 years with Barcelona
252.article_body: Spanish defender Gerard Piqué has announced his retirement from football after 14 years with Barcelona. Sharing a video on social media, Piqué stated that Barcelona's La Liga match against Almería on Saturday will be the last match of his career. The 35-year-old has played 615 matches for Barcelona, winning eight La Liga titles and three Champions League titles.

253.title: Schools in Noida & Greater Noida to hold online classes till Nov 8 amid pollution
253.article_body: Schools in Noida and Greater Noida will hold online classes for students of Classes 1-8 till November 8 in view of rising pollution in Delhi-NCR, as per an official order. Schools have also been told to hold online classes for students of Classes 9-12 "as far as possible". All outdoor activities in schools are also banned until further orders.

254.title: Don't look at fake fielding as reason for not reaching target: Harsha to Bangladesh fans
254.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle, in a message to Bangladesh fans, said, "Please don't look at fake fielding or wet conditions as a reason for not reaching the target." He added, "If one of the batters had stayed till the end, Bangladesh could have won it. We are all guilty of it...when we search for excuses, we don't grow."

255.title: India abstains from Russia-sponsored draft resolution at UNSC
255.article_body: India has abstained from voting at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) on a resolution sponsored by Russia to investigate alleged "military biological activities" being carried out by Ukraine. The resolution failed to get adopted as the US, the UK and France voted against it. Only, Russia and China voted in support.

256.title: Freshworks faces class action lawsuits over 'false' IPO papers
256.article_body: Nasdaq-listed Freshworks is facing class action lawsuits over false and misleading offering papers filed by the company ahead of its IPO. Law firms alleged that Freshworks didn't state that it encountered obstacles at the time of the offering. Freshworks offered 28.5 million shares at $36 per share to raise over $1 billion at a valuation of nearly $10 billion.

257.title: India, UK working sincerely on free trade agreement: MEA
257.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said it is working "sincerely" with the UK government for finalisation of the proposed free trade agreement. "Both sides are working sincerely on the free trade agreement," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. This comes days after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his British counterpart Rishi Sunak agreed on "early conclusion" of the deal.

258.title: Heavy rains inundate several areas in Puducherry
258.article_body: Heavy rains inundated several areas and almost all thoroughfares in Puducherry on Thursday. On the day, Puducherry, including suburban areas, received 5 cm of rain till 4.30 pm. CM N Rangasamy chaired an emergency meeting to take stock of relief and rehabilitation works. Later, Rangasamy told reporters "all necessary steps have been taken to ensure that people face no hardship".

259.title: Rajeev reacts to cheating allegations by Charu, accuses her of 'romance with Karan Mehra'
259.article_body: After Charu Asopa accused actor Rajeev Sen of cheating on her, Rajeev said, "She has no proof...her ego has gone out of the roof." Talking about voice notes sent to him by Charu's mother, Rajeev said, "One of the points to be noted from...voice note is her romance with...actor Karan Mehra." "She has major trust issues, not me," he added.

260.title: Activist refuses to speak to journalist for not wearing bindi in Maha, video surfaces
260.article_body: Maharashtra activist Sambhaji Bhide refused to speak to a journalist as she wasn't wearing a bindi. The incident was caught on camera and the clip of the television channel went viral. "Every woman is like Bharat Mata and Bharat Mata is not widow," Sambhaji Bhide said to the journalist.  The state women's commission has served a notice to Sambhaji.

261.title: I respect Bibi Jagir Kaur a lot: SAD chief after party suspends her
261.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Thursday said that he and his father, ex-Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal, respect Bibi Jagir Kaur a lot. "I can say that I never said no to Bibi ji for anything," the chief added. This comes after SAD suspended Kaur from the primary membership of the party over alleged anti-party activities.

262.title: Terrorist gunned down along LoC in J&K's Poonch: Army
262.article_body: The Army gunned down a terrorist in Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday, foiling an infiltration bid along the Line of Control (LoC), officials said. The security personnel challenged the terrorists after noticing suspicious movements along the LoC. A pistol, two AK-47 rifles, and war-like stores were recovered, an Army spokesperson said.

263.title: Lyft to lay off 13% of its workforce in second round of job cuts
263.article_body: Lyft said that it will lay off 13% of its workforce in its second round of job cuts. The ride-hailing company froze hiring in US in September as a cost cutting measure and also laid off about 60 workers earlier this year. "The announced reduction in force is a proactive step as part of the company's annual planning," Lyft said.

264.title: 8 ex-Navy officers detained in Qatar, trying to secure their early release: MEA
264.article_body: The MEA said on Thursday that the Indian embassy in Doha is making efforts to secure the early release and repatriation of eight ex-Navy officers who've been detained there. The concerned persons were reportedly working for a private company in Qatar. "The detained persons have also spoken to their family members on a few occasions," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said.

265.title: Cholera spreading 'rapidly' in Lebanon: WHO
265.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) said cholera is spreading "rapidly" in Lebanon. The disease has spread to all parts of the country with around 1,400 suspected cases presently, according to the WHO. WHO Regional Emergency Director Rick Brennan said the disease may have come from neighbouring Syria. The first cholera case reported in Lebanon was in 1993.

266.title: Leave Iran immediately: German government to its citizens
266.article_body: The German Ministry of Foreign Affairs has asked all its citizens to immediately leave Iran, saying there is a "concrete danger of being arbitrarily arrested, interrogated and sentenced to long prison terms". The ministry added that dual nationals with German and Iranian citizenship are also at risk. The notice comes as the Iranian government is trying to control women-led protests.

267.title: Vodafone Idea's Q2 loss widens to ₹7,595.5 cr over subscriber loss
267.article_body: Telecom operator Vodafone Idea's net consolidated loss widened to ₹7,595.5 crore in the second quarter ended September. The company had posted a loss of ₹7,132.3 crore in the same period a year ago. Vodafone Idea's subscriber base declined to 23.44 crore in the September quarter compared to 24 crore in the previous quarter.

268.title: Vajpayee & PM Modi gave importance to HP like no one else: Rajnath
268.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said only two prime ministers, ex-PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee and PM Narendra Modi, have given "importance to Himachal Pradesh like nobody else". "People of [India] can evaluate...what earlier governments did and what present government is doing," Singh said at a meeting in Solan. Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh will be held on November 12.

269.title: Turkey's annual inflation climbs to 24-year high of 85.5%
269.article_body: Turkey's annual inflation hit its 24-year high of 85.51% in October this year, according to official data on Thursday. The country has recorded severe inflation since last year, when the lira also fell in value. According to reports, the economic situation is a fallout of the central bank cutting its policy rate.

270.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
270.article_body: The IMD issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs for next few days. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Kerala and Tamil Nadu from November 4 to 7 and over Puducherry from November 5 to 7. It's very likely over Jammu and Kashmir on November 6 and over Andaman and Nicobar Islands on November 7.

271.title: EAM S Jaishankar to visit Moscow on November 7 & 8
271.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will visit Moscow, Russia on November 7 and 8, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Thursday. During his visit, Jaishankar is expected to hold meetings with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov and Deputy Prime Minister of Trade and Industry Denis Manturov. Talks on economic cooperation are set to feature prominently during the meetings.

272.title: Odisha Assembly’s winter session to start from November 24
272.article_body: The Odisha Assembly's winter session will start on November 24 and end on December 31, according to a statement issued by the Assembly Secretariat. There will be 33 working days in the session and five 'no meeting' days. On November 24, the first supplementary expenditure statement for the year 2022-23 is expected to be presented in the House.

273.title: Ratan Tata-owned Electra EV raises $25 mn from GEF Capital
273.article_body: Ratan Tata-owned Electrodrive Powertrain Solutions Ltd, or Electra EV raised $25 million from GEF Capital Partners' South Asia Growth Fund II for a minority stake in the EV startup. The EV startup has a manufacturing plant in Coimbatore and an R&D centre in Pune. Electra's powertrain solutions have been installed in Tata Xpres-T (fleet) and Tata Ace EV.

274.title: Not receiving instructions from my client, discharge me from case: Mallya's lawyer to SC
274.article_body: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya's lawyer EC Agrawala has urged Supreme Court to relieve him from Mallya's case, saying, "I'm not receiving any instructions from this man." He added, "Mallya has been incommunicado for a long time." The court asked him to provide Mallya’s email and residential address in UK to the court registry and allowed him to initiate discharge proceedings.

275.title: How does the points table of India's group in T20 WC read after Pakistan's 2nd win?
275.article_body: Pakistan on Thursday registered their second victory in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. India are on top of Group 2 points table with six points. They are followed by South Africa (five points) and Pakistan (four points). Netherlands are placed last and are out of the semi-finals race, having accumulated two points in four matches.

276.title: Pakistan's Nawaz doesn't take DRS for LBW thinking he is run out, video goes viral
276.article_body: Pakistan's Muhammad Nawaz didn't take DRS for LBW despite his bat touching ball and walked off after being run out on the same delivery against South Africa. A video of the same has gone viral. Nawaz would've been not out had he reviewed the decision as the umpire had declared him LBW out, which would have been overturned by DRS.

277.title: You're sometimes taken lightly in a male-dominated industry: Sargun
277.article_body: Actress-producer Sargun Mehta has said, "As a woman working in an industry that's predominantly ruled by men, sometimes you're taken lightly." However, she added that she tries and sees the good thing in it. Sargun stated that people thought they could take her for a ride by assuming that she did not know anything, but, she "knew a little more".

278.title: Kerala court orders 'Kantara' makers to stop playing 'Varaha...' in theatres, OTT
278.article_body: Palakkad District Court has issued an ad-interim injunction, directing the makers of 'Kantara' to stop playing the song 'Varaha Roopam' in theatres and OTT platforms. This comes after Kerala-based band Thaikkudam Bridge accused 'Kantara' makers of copying 'Varaha Roopam' from their song 'Navarasam'. Mathrubhumi Printing and Publishing Company Ltd filed a copyright infringement suit against makers.

279.title: Vote for AAP, will take you to Ayodhya temple: Kejriwal to Guj people
279.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday shared a video message on Twitter in Gujarati. "I'll build you schools and hospitals, give you free electricity...take you to the Ram Temple in Ayodhya...Give me one chance," he said. Voting for the Gujarat Assembly elections will take place on December 1 and December 5.

280.title: Video shows Raj minister asking bureaucrat to 'get out' of meeting
280.article_body: A video has surfaced showing Rajasthan Health Minister Parsadi Lal Meena asking a Zila Parishad CEO to leave a meeting which was being held at Dausa collectorate. The minister reportedly asked the bureaucrat to "get out" after the latter gave him 'unsatisfactory' response regarding the approval of MLA funds. The video showed the CEO leaving the meeting with his files.

281.title: Microsoft extends free tech support for Ukraine through 2023
281.article_body: Microsoft will extend technology support free of charge for Ukraine throughout 2023, the company announced. Microsoft said it would provide additional technology aid of nearly $100 million, bringing its total support for the war-hit country to over $400 million since the crisis began in February. Earlier in June, Microsoft said it was making substantial cuts to its business in Russia.

282.title: Chitra Wagh appointed as President of Maharashtra BJP women's wing
282.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Thursday appointed Chitra Wagh as the President of the Maharashtra Pradesh Mahila Morcha, the women's wing of the party. After taking over from her predecessor Uma Khapre, Wagh tweeted and thanked Bawankule and Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis for giving her the responsibility. Before joining the BJP, Wagh was incharge of the NCP's women's wing.

283.title: Kejriwal refused to use bio-decomposer in Punjab: Bhupender Yadav
283.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had "officially refused" to use the Pusa bio-decomposer in Punjab to curb stubble burning. The Pusa bio-decomposer can turn paddy straw into manure in 15-20 days. Yadav added that no Delhi government representative participated in National Conference of Environment Ministers in Gujarat in September.

284.title: K'taka govt withdraws tender reserving job of managing slippers for SCs, STs
284.article_body: Karnataka government's Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Department on Wednesday issued a tender reserving job of managing slippers at temples for people from Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Scheduled Tribes (STs). It was withdrawn on the same day citing "technical reasons". It invited other works like supply of tender coconut too but only kept job of managing slippers reserved.

285.title: Video shows the moment of firing at Imran Khan's Pakistan rally
285.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan was shot in the leg on Thursday at a political rally in Wazirabad. A video of the incident showed Khan and his supporters ducking on top of a lorry. Multiple gunshots, including from an automatic rifle, are heard as the crowd panics. Khan was taken to a hospital in Lahore after he sustained injury.

286.title: Mamata plays drums at WB Guv's function in Chennai, video surfaces
286.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday took to playing drums at state Governor La Ganesan's family function in Chennai, a video of which has surfaced online. Banerjee was attending the 80th birthday celebrations of Ganesan's brother. Notably, Banerjee also paid a courtesy call to Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, stating that she couldn't leave without meeting him.

287.title: Leave Iran or risk arrest, long prison terms: Germany to its nationals
287.article_body: Germany on Thursday urged its citizens to leave Iran or risk arrest and long prison terms there. "Dual nationals who have Iranian as well as German citizenship are at risk," a statement by Germany's foreign ministry read. The statement comes amid widespread protests in Iran since the custodial death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was imprisoned for wearing 'improper hijab'.

288.title: Ensure security at Kejriwal's house: Delhi HC to police after vandalism row
288.article_body: The Delhi HC has directed city police to ensure that security measures are undertaken to guard CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence. The direction came in response to a PIL by AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj which sought formation of an SIT to probe vandalism that broke out outside Kejriwal's house in March. Some people had protested against Kejriwal's remarks on 'The Kashmir Files'.

289.title: Janhvi Kapoor and her family buy duplex apartment for ₹65 crore in Mumbai
289.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor and her family have bought a duplex apartment in Mumbai's Bandra West area for ₹65 crore, documents accessed by Indextap.com showed. The apartment, with a carpet area of 6,421 sq ft, is located on the first and second floors of a building. The property has been jointly bought by Janhvi, her father Boney Kapoor and sister Khushi Kapoor.

290.title: I wish that I had a bigger role in 'Vikram Vedha': Radhika Apte
290.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte, speaking about why she did 'Vikram Vedha' despite her role being small, has said that she wanted to work with directors Pushkar and Gayatri. "I've rejected many films that had my role at the centre but I did not like the script...but I did wish...I had a bigger role in 'Vikram Vedha'," she added.

291.title: Elon Musk to restore Twitter content-moderation tools: Report
291.article_body: Twitter's new owner, Elon Musk reportedly said that he will restore the content-moderation tools, blocked for some staff, by the end of the week. Last week, Twitter limited the number of staff that have access to the social media platform's tool dashboard to enforce policy actions, Bloomberg reported. Musk made the promise to civil rights leaders over a Zoom meeting.

292.title: Stripe to lay off 14% of workforce, CEO says 'overhired for the world we're in'
292.article_body: Electronic payments company Stripe on Thursday announced that it's laying off 14% of its workforce, impacting around 1,120 of its 8,000 employees. In a memo, CEO Patrick Collison wrote, "We overhired for the world we're in, and it pains us to be unable to deliver the experience." The layoffs come months after Stripe reportedly cut its internal valuation by 28%.

293.title: Bank of England increases interest rates by 0.75%, biggest hike in 33 years
293.article_body: The Bank of England raised interest rates by 75 basis points to 3%, its largest single hike in 33 years. The move was announced after consumer price inflation returned to a 40-year high in September. It comes after the US Federal Reserve announced a fourth consecutive three-quarter point jump on Wednesday to combat growing inflation.

294.title: Amber Heard deletes Twitter account days after ex-boyfriend Elon Musk's takeover: Reports
294.article_body: Days after Elon Musk acquired Twitter, actress Amber Heard's account has disappeared. The disappearance of Heard's account was first noticed by YouTuber Matthew Lewis, who tweeted, "Amber Heard has deleted her Twitter." It's unclear when or why Heard removed her account, or the reasons surrounding the deactivation. Heard was reportedly in a relationship with Musk between 2016 and 2018.

295.title: Janhvi started dieting at 13, scolded her for ordering grilled fish with no butter: Boney
295.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor has revealed that his daughter Janhvi started dieting when she was 13. "I scolded Janhvi...when...[she] ordered a grilled fish with no butter...I was like, 'What's the fun of having fish without butter?'" Boney said. "I used to be stressed while going out with Janhvi as she used to select...restaurant where she'll get her diet food," he added.

296.title: BJP will definitely win Gujarat Assembly polls: Union minister Sonowal
296.article_body: Union minister and BJP leader Sarbananda Sonowal said his party will definitely win the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. "Under the leadership of PM Modi, the work that has happened in Gujarat has become a model of development for the whole country," Sonowal said. His comment comes after the Election Commission of India (ECI) announced the schedule for the state election.

297.title: Omar won't contest polls if J&K's statehood not restored: Farooq
297.article_body: Former CM Omar Abdullah will not contest Assembly elections till statehood is restored to Jammu and Kashmir, his father and National Conference President Farooq Abdullah said on Thursday. The MP also dismissed suggestions that the party's constituency in-charges would get the party mandate for the elections. "No one is the MLA candidate. We will have talks about coalitions," he added.

298.title: Delhi govt extends last date to apply for power subsidy to November 15
298.article_body: The Delhi government on Thursday extended the last date to apply for power subsidy to November 15. Earlier, the last date to submit the application online or offline was October 31 and over 34 lakh of around 57 lakh consumers had applied for the subsidy by then. The government will provide subsidy to only those consumers who apply for it.

299.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Ram Setu' domestically collects ₹58.90 crore
299.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Jacqueline Fernandez's 'Ram Setu' has collected ₹58.90 crore across India since its release on October 25. The film, which also starred Nushrratt Bharuccha, had collected ₹15.25 crore on its opening day. Akshay's 'Ram Setu' released on Diwali along with 'Thank God', which featured Sidharth Malhotra and Ajay Devgn.

300.title: EC must explain separate poll dates for Himachal, Gujarat: Cong
300.article_body: Congress asked the Election Commission to explain why elections in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh were announced for separate dates when counting of votes will be on the same day. Congress's Gujarat in-charge Raghu Sharma said the party is working hard in Gujarat and results will be "surprising". Gujarat will go to polls in two phases on December 1 and 5.

301.title: Centre seeks report on Satyendar Jain's 'special treatment' in Tihar jail
301.article_body: The MHA has sought a report from Delhi's Chief Secretary on allegations that Tihar jail officials are rendering "special treatment" to AAP's Satyendar Jain. This comes after purported footage of Jain receiving body massage inside his cell was submitted by Enforcement Directorate (ED) to a special court. The ED also said that Jain was provided with salads in his cell.

302.title: Protestors from Punjab, AAP workers clash during Kejriwal's speech in Himachal
302.article_body: Protestors from Punjab, who are members of Punjab ETT Teachers Association, clashed with AAP workers during Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal's speech at a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh's Solan. Protestors raised slogans against AAP and Punjab government, forcing Kejriwal to cut short his speech. "If you (protestors) want this 'gundagardi' (hooliganism), you should go to BJP," Kejriwal said.

303.title: Hero MotoCorp reports 10% fall in net profit at ₹716 crore in Q2
303.article_body: Hero MotoCorp posted a 9.9% year-on-year decrease in standalone net profit at ₹716 crore for the quarter ended September. Revenue from operations grew by 7.4% from ₹8,453.40 crore in the same quarter last fiscal to ₹9,075.35 crore in Q2. Company's total sales saw a 17% fall at 4,54,582 units in October 2022 as compared with 5,47,970 units in October 2021.

304.title: Projects worth ₹2 lakh cr approved for Maharashtra: PM Modi
304.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the Centre has approved projects worth ₹2 lakh crore for Maharashtra. PM Modi's announcement comes as the Shinde-Fadnavis government faces flak from the Opposition for losing out proposed big-ticket projects to poll-bound Gujarat. He said that ₹75,000 crore worth of railway projects and ₹50,000 crore worth of projects for modern roads were approved.

305.title: Man tears, burns pages of Quran at mosque in UP; arrested
305.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly tearing and burning few pages of holy book Quran at a mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur on Wednesday. Police said a CCTV footage revealed that Taj Mohammad secretly entered the mosque, damaged the book and escaped without being noticed by anyone. Some locals engaged in arson while protesting against the crime.

306.title: Global Health IPO subscribed 26% on first day of offering
306.article_body: Global Health, which operates the Medanta brand of hospitals, launched its maiden public offering, receiving 26% subscription on the first day. The IPO attracted bids for 1,19,50,268 shares against 4,67,42,397 shares on offer, according to data from NSE. The IPO has a fresh issue of up to ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of up to 5,07,61,000 equity shares.

307.title: K'taka MLA Renukacharya's nephew found dead in car days after he went missing
307.article_body: Karnataka BJP MLA M P Renukacharya's nephew Chandrashekar, who was missing since Sunday, was found dead inside a car that had fallen into a canal. The car was found near Kadadakatte in Honnali taluk of Davanagere district on Thursday. The MLA earlier said that he suspected that Chandrashekar might have been kidnapped as his father is a contractor.

308.title: Bollywood actress is lot more than being size zero: Double XL's Huma
308.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, who features in 'Double XL', was asked to give a message to girls who feel that being size zero is the way to enter the film industry. "Not at all...It is your talent and hard work. If you want to be a Hindi film actress, there is a lot more than being just size zero," Huma stated.

309.title: Woman dies by suicide over irregularities in kitty party fund in MP
309.article_body: A 33-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide in Madhya Pradesh's Indore over alleged irregularities in a kitty party fund, police have said. In a note, she has blamed some people for troubling her over a kitty party fund dispute. Her husband has said that the alleged dispute is worth several lakh rupees, police said.

310.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif seeks immediate report on attack on Imran Khan
310.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has sought an immediate report on the attack on former Pakistan PM and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) chief Imran Khan. Taking to Twitter Sharif said, "I pray for the recovery and health of PTI chairman Khan...Violence should have no place in our country's politics." Khan was shot in his leg during his rally in Wazirabad on Thursday.

311.title: Drugs worth ₹79 lakh seized in Surat, Mumbai-based drug peddler held
311.article_body: The Surat Police arrested a Mumbai-based drug peddler and seized 792 grams of mephedrone drug worth ₹79.28 lakh along with ₹1,100 cash and two mobile phones on Wednesday. The peddler was identified as 35-year-old Mohammed Ahmed alias Monu, a resident of Mumbai's Dharavi. Based on tip-off, police intercepted a youth walking with travel bag, in which the drugs were found.

312.title: HPCL reports net loss of ₹2,172 cr in Q2, revenue falls by 5.3%
312.article_body: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation (HPCL) reported a standalone net loss of ₹2,172 crore for the quarter ended September 2022. The company had registered a profit of ₹1,923 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. During the quarter, the company’s revenue declined 5.3% sequentially to ₹1.08 lakh crore from ₹1.14 lakh crore in the June quarter.

313.title: Harvey Weinstein masturbated in front of me, grabbed my breasts: Massage therapist
313.article_body: A licensed massage therapist recounted her ordeal in court and alleged that Harvey Weinstein masturbated in front of her during business appointments. She added that while he was masturbating, he put his other hand underneath her tank top and grabbed her breasts, adding that it left a red mark on her chest. "He just kept yelling at me," she said.

314.title: Wipro appoints former Capgemini executive Amit Choudhary as COO
314.article_body: IT firm Wipro has appointed former Capgemini executive Amit Choudhary as Chief Operating Officer (COO) and member of the company's executive board. The position remained vacant after former COO Bhanumurthy Ballapuram retired in July 2021. Choudhary will be responsible for improving organisational operational efficiency and helping drive sustainable growth, Wipro said.

315.title: Twitter notifications aren't working: US Congresswoman after blue tick row
315.article_body: US Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (AOC) on Wednesday said her Twitter "mentions/notifications conveniently aren't working". "Just a reminder that money will never buy your way out of insecurity, folks," AOC tweeted. After Twitter CEO Elon Musk had announced his plan to charge $8/month for the blue checkmark, AOC had said, "Lmao at a billionaire...[selling] 'free speech'...[for] $8/month."

316.title: Unknown woman appeared naked in WhatsApp video call, alleges K'taka BJP MLA
316.article_body: Karnataka BJP MLA GH Thippareddy has filed a police complaint over a possible attempt by unknown persons to trap him in a sex video. The MLA stated in his complaint that on October 31, he received a WhatsApp video call in which an unknown woman appeared naked. The caller shared a vulgar video after he disconnected, he alleged.

317.title: Australia offers ₹5.2-cr reward for info on Indian man who allegedly killed woman on beach
317.article_body: The Australian police on Thursday announced AU$1 million (₹5.2 crore) reward for any information on an Indian male nurse named Rajwinder Singh who allegedly killed a 24-year-old woman on a beach in Queensland in 2018. Rajwinder, who is the key person of interest in the case, had escaped from Australia two days after the woman was killed.

318.title: I'd sound good singing with Rihanna, Billie Eilish, Sia: Aditya Narayan
318.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan said there are a few international artists that he would like to collaborate with. "Rihanna is one of my favourite artists, Sia, Billie Eilish, and Dua Lipa, I think I'd sound good singing with these talented ladies that I am a huge, huge fan of," he further added. Aditya voiced the Hindi version of 'Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile'.

319.title: 8i Ventures marks first close of second fund at $25 mn
319.article_body: Venture capital firm 8i Ventures marked the first close of its second fund at $25 million after getting investments from family offices like Salgaocars and Kothari (DSP). The fund, launched in December last year, expects to mark the final close of the $50-million fund by March 2023. 8i Ventures was founded in 2019 by Vikram Chachra and Vishwanath V.

320.title: IMD issues 'orange alert' for three districts in Kerala
320.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an 'orange alert' for three districts in southern Kerala. Kottayam, Pathanamthitta and Idukki are likely to witness very heavy rainfall on Friday, according to a statement. Northeast monsoon has been active over Kerala and rain or thundershower is likely for the next five days due to a cyclonic circulation over south Tamil Nadu.

321.title: Yes Bank to close stressed asset sale to JC Flowers ARC this month: CEO
321.article_body: Yes Bank CEO and Managing Director Prashant Kumar said that the company is expecting to close its stressed asset sale of over ₹48,000 crore to JC Flowers ARC by the end of November. JC Flowers has committed to pay ₹11,183 crore for the entire pool of the stressed loans, which assures a 23% recovery to the bank.

322.title: CM Kejriwal's negligence fatal for people: Manoj Tiwari on air pollution
322.article_body: As Delhi's AQI crossed 400-mark to remain in 'severe' category, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari on Thursday criticised CM Arvind Kejriwal and said his negligence is fatal for the people of the national capital.  "He installed...smog tower just to show the media and today that too is closed," he added. Kejriwal claims that each smog tower costs ₹2 crore, Tiwari added.

323.title: MoS Home's convoy allegedly attacked in Bengal's Cooch Behar
323.article_body: Union Minister of State (MoS) for Home Nisith Pramanik alleged that his convoy was attacked in West Bengal's Cooch Behar district on Thursday. However, police said it was a "minor scuffle" as some people tried to wave black flags at him. Pramanik said BJP workers won't sit quietly if their minister is attacked in front of them.

324.title: Actor-politician Shashi Kumar, ex-Cong MP & others join BJP in K'taka
324.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Shashi Kumar, former Congress MP SP Muddahanumegowda and retired IAS officer BH Anil Kumar joined the BJP in poll-bound Karnataka on Thursday in the presence of CM Basavaraj Bommai. Congress Seva Dal state Vice-President Hanumantrao Javali, Samajwadi Party leader HY Ravikumar and former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit’s special officer Ramesh Muniyappa also joined the ruling party.

325.title: Terrorists open fire upon 2 migrant labourers working at school in J&K
325.article_body: Terrorists opened fire at two migrant labourers, one from Bihar and another from Nepal, working at a private school in Bondialgam area of Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Thursday evening. Both labourers have been shifted to the hospital, Kashmir Zone Police said. While one labourer has reportedly suffered a head injury, the other has been injured in his abdomen.

326.title: Sandalwood tree stolen from Odisha Raj Bhavan in Bhubaneswar
326.article_body: A sandalwood tree has been allegedly stolen from the high-security premises of Odisha Raj Bhavan in Bhubaneswar, police said. The tree was cut on Tuesday and the Raj Bhavan filed a complaint. CCTV camera footage of the area is being checked, police said, adding that no arrests have been made so far.

327.title: Boney shares old pic with Sridevi, Janhvi; says 'I'm Janhvi's biggest fan'
327.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor took to Instagram and shared an old picture with his late wife Sridevi and daughter Janhvi Kapoor. Along with the picture, Boney wrote, "I felt like the king of the world when meri Janhvi mujhe 'mili' [my Janhvi met me]...I'm easily her biggest fan!" He added that he knew Janhvi would make him proud.

328.title: No matter how powerful the corrupt may be, they shouldn't be saved: PM
328.article_body: Addressing an event marking Vigilance Awareness Week of the Central Vigilance Commission, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday called for "zero tolerance" against corruption. He said, "No matter how powerful the corrupt may be, they should not be saved under any circumstances." "No corrupt person should get political-social support, every corrupt person should be put in...dock by the society," he added.

329.title: UCO Bank's Q2 net profit surges by 145% to ₹504 crore
329.article_body: UCO Bank on Thursday reported a 145% rise in its net profit to ₹504.52 crore in the July-September quarter, as against ₹205.4 crore in the year-ago period. Total revenue of the Kolkata-headquartered lender in the quarter rose to ₹4,964.84 crore from ₹4,655.86 crore in the year-ago quarter. Interest income during Q2 rose to ₹4,184.89 crore from ₹3,719.79 crore.

330.title: 6 men trapped in Cambodia on pretext of IT jobs rescued by TN govt
330.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has rescued six men who were trapped in Cambodia on the pretext of jobs in the IT sector. The men have reportedly been brought back to India and sent back to their respective hometowns. "People who look for jobs abroad from Tamil Nadu are [often] misguided by fake agents," state Minorities Welfare Minister Gingee KS Masthan said.

331.title: Student punished for raising 'Bharat Mata ki Jai' slogan in MP school
331.article_body: Two teachers were booked for allegedly punishing a student for raising "Bharat Mata ki Jai" slogan after assembly at Christ Senior Secondary School in Madhya Pradesh's Guna. The incident came to light on Thursday after parents staged a protest outside the school. The principal of the school, however, said that the student chanted the slogan as a joke, not patriotism.

332.title: My father never wanted me to get married: Jaya Bachchan
332.article_body: Jaya Bachchan has revealed that her father never wanted her to get married. After Amitabh Bachchan proposed to her for marriage, Jaya's father told her that he hasn't brought her into this world to just educate herself, get married and have children. Amitabh convinced him by saying, "My parents are alive. I want them to attend [the wedding]", she revealed.

333.title: 5 smartphones seized from high-security zone in Punjab's Sangrur jail
333.article_body: The police recovered five smartphones from gangsters during a raid from the high-security zone in Punjab's Sangrur jail on Thursday morning, the police said. Sim cards were installed in four smartphones, while one smartphone was without a sim card. The raid was led by SP Palvinder Singh Cheema and included five DSPs, seven SHOs and over 100 policemen.

334.title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif condemns attack on Imran Khan, seeks report
334.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has 'severely condemned' the attack on former Pakistan PM Imran Khan. He also sought an immediate report on the incident from top police and government officials, Pak newspaper Dawn reported. Reportedly, Khan was shot in his leg in firing during his rally in Pakistan's Wazirabad on Thursday. The firing was reported near the container of Khan.

335.title: 55-yr-old woman mauled to death by tiger in Maha's Chandrapur
335.article_body: A 55-year-old woman, Jaibai Tondare, was mauled to death by a tiger on Thursday in Brahmapuri in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district, a forest official said. The incident took place in the afternoon when the woman was engaged in farm work. The family of the deceased has been given ₹20,000 as initial compensation, Chief Conservator of Forests Prakash Lonkar said.

336.title: JMM workers hold protest rally in Ranchi against ED summons to Soren
336.article_body: JMM workers on Thursday took out a rally in Ranchi to protest against Enforcement Directorate's summons to CM Hemant Soren for questioning in a money laundering probe. JMM workers shouted slogans against BJP and marched to the CM's residence where Soren addressed them. He claimed the summons was a part of a conspiracy hatched by BJP to destabilise his government.

337.title: Air quality panel bans diesel LMVs in Delhi-NCR, asks states to decide on school closure
337.article_body: Centre's air quality panel has asked states to decide on closure of schools, non-emergency commercial activities and implementing odd-even scheme for vehicles amid rising pollution in Delhi-NCR. The panel has banned plying of diesel LMVs in Delhi-NCR. BS-VI, essential and emergency services vehicles will be exempted. It has ordered closure of industries that aren't running on clean fuels in NCR.

338.title: Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' collects over ₹500 crore globally
338.article_body: Mani Ratnam's directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' has collected over ₹500 crore at the box office globally. The film, which features Vikram and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, collected close to ₹335 crore across India. 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', which released on September 30, collected around ₹230 crore in the state of Tamil Nadu. The second instalment of the film will release in 2023.

339.title: K'taka woman gives birth to twins at home after hospital shuns her, all die
339.article_body: A 30-year-old woman and her newborn twins died in Karnataka's Tumakuru on Thursday after the district hospital refused to admit her for delivery there. The deceased woman, identified as Kasturi, gave birth to her twin boys at her residence, shortly after which she died due to profuse bleeding. Locals have reportedly sought the suspension of the concerned doctors and staff.

340.title: Meta India head Ajit Mohan quits with immediate effect
340.article_body: Meta India country head Ajit Mohan has stepped down from the company with immediate effect, Nicola Mendelsohn, Vice President, Global Business Group, Meta said in a statement. Ajit had joined Meta as the Managing Director for the India market in January 2019. As per reports, Ajit will join Snap, where he will serve as the President of the APAC business.

341.title: Lashkar-e-Taiba associate arrested in Pulwama, grenade recovered
341.article_body: Police arrested a militant associate of terrorist outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) during a surprise check in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Thursday. The associate has been identified as Zubair Ahmad Dar, a resident of Pulwama. Police said Zubair was tasked to carry out attacks on security forces and non-local labourers in the area. A hand grenade was recovered from his possession.

342.title: Cognizant's Q3 profit rises by 15.6% YoY to $629 mn, revenue up by 2.4%
342.article_body: IT services company Cognizant reported a 15.6% increase in net profit to $629 million for the third quarter as against $544 million in the year-ago period. Cognizant's revenue for the Q3 grew 2.4% year-over-year to about $4.9 billion. The New Jersey-based firm revised its revenue growth guidance in constant currency terms for the full year to 7% from 8.5-9.5%.

343.title: Ex-Miss Barbados claims Miss World 2000 was 'rigged' to favour Priyanka
343.article_body: A YouTuber and former Miss Barbados 2000 alleged that the Miss World pageant of 2000, which Priyanka Chopra won, was "rigged". Leilani McConney said the show was sponsored by ZeeTV, an Indian cable station, and alleged that Priyanka was 'favoured'. Leilani claimed in her video that Priyanka's gowns were better made and she was even allowed food in her room.

344.title: Lawyer carries gun into courtroom during case hearing in Bihar, arrested
344.article_body: A lawyer was arrested in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district for allegedly carrying a gun to the court during the hearing of a case, police said on Thursday. "The judge...asked his security guards to take the weapon from the possession of the advocate, and ordered his...arrest," a police officer said. The arrested lawyer has claimed that he's the victim of a conspiracy.

345.title: I wanted to kill Imran Khan because he was misleading people, confesses shooter in video
345.article_body: The suspect who shot at former Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad, confessed in a video, "I wanted to kill Imran Khan because he was misleading people." "I wanted to kill only Imran Khan and no one else...I came alone on my bike. There was no one else with me," he added.

346.title: Woman injured after portion of slab collapses at Mumbai's KEM Hospital
346.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was injured after a portion of a slab collapsed in the nurses hostel of KEM Hospital in Mumbai's Parel. Shiv Sena leader Anil Kokil said he'd raised the issue of the faulty slab but the administration didn't pay attention. The hospital administration, however, said major repair works will be undertaken in the next four to six weeks.

347.title: AirAsia India-Air India Express merger likely by 2023-end: Air India
347.article_body: Air India said an operational review process is underway to integrate budget carrier AirAsia India with Air India Express and the merger is likely by the end of 2023.
