Tata Group-owned Air India has also signed agreements to have a 100% stake in AirAsia India. Post-merger, the entity will be branded as Air India Express, according to a statement.

348.title: Delhi Metro's Airport Line to be affected till Nov-end for maintenance
348.article_body: Services on the Airport Express Line will be affected till the end of November due to track maintenance work, Delhi Metro said on Thursday. Regular announcements shall be made at stations and in trains accordingly to ensure that passengers are not inconvenienced, officials said. The 23-km line connects New Delhi and Delhi Sector-21 metro stations.

349.title: Man caught urinating on Delhi Metro track, says 'zyada ho gaya'
349.article_body: A Twitter user has shared a video in which a man can be seen urinating on the tracks of a Delhi Metro station. In the video, the man can be heard saying, "Ho gaya, zyada ho gaya (I [drank] a little too much)," on being asked, "Why are you urinating here?" The Twitter user tagged CMO Delhi in his tweet.

350.title: 26-year-old man dies after falling from building during a fight in Thane
350.article_body: A 26-year-old man died after falling from second floor of a building in Thane while fighting with another person, an official said. The victim, Sadique Ansari, and the other person entered into an argument over bringing water. During the fight, both fell from the building and sustained injuries. While Ansari died on the spot, the other person has been hospitalised.

351.title: Telangana BJP prez Bandi Sanjay detained enroute Munugode, released
351.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay was taken into preventive custody enroute to Munugode Assembly constituency where polling is underway today. He was staging a protest demanding that non-locals and TRS leaders should be sent out of the constituency since campaigning was over. After being shifted to Abdullapurmet Police Station, he was later released and taken to the state BJP office.

352.title: K'taka govt grants in-principle approval for Bengaluru Metro phase 3
352.article_body: The Karnataka government has granted in-principle approval for the Bengaluru Metro's phase 3, which comprises two lines. The first will run a length of 32.16 km from Kempapura to JP Nagar Fourth Phase and the second will run 12.82 km from Hosahalli to Kadabagere. The Kempapura-JP Nagar line will have 22 stations, while the Hosahalli-Kadabagere line will have nine stations.

353.title: Five Star Business Finance sets IPO band at 10.6% below unlisted price
353.article_body: Five Star Business Finance has fixed the IPO price band at ₹450-474 per share, about 10.6% below the current unlisted price. The ₹1,960 crore IPO, which is a pure offer for sale, opens for subscription on November 9 and closes on November 11. The company will offer shares to anchor investors on November 7 ahead of the IPO.

354.title: Raymond's Q2 net profit jumps over two-fold to ₹162 crore
354.article_body: Raymond reported over a two-fold jump in its consolidated net profit to ₹161.95 crore for the quarter ended September 30. Its revenue from operations increased by 39.76% to ₹2,168.24 crore from ₹1,551.32 crore in the corresponding quarter previous fiscal. Raymond’s total expenses surged 31.27% to ₹1,954.18 crore in the quarter against ₹1,488.64 crore a year back.

355.title: We'll continue to monitor ongoing developments: India after Imran Khan shot in the leg
355.article_body: Speaking about former Pakistan PM Imran Khan being shot in the leg in Wazirabad, India's Ministry of External Affairs said, "It's a development that just took place." "We're closely keeping an eye on [it] and we'll continue to monitor ongoing developments," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi. "[We] don't have anything beyond that to say as it's...a developing story," he added.

356.title: HDFC's net profit grows 17.8% in Q2 at ₹4,454.24 crore
356.article_body: HDFC reported a net profit of ₹4,454.24 crore in the July-September quarter, experiencing a year-on-year growth of 17.8% on the back of robust loan growth. The company's total interest income was ₹13,142.93 crore, increasing by 24.2% from a year ago period. HDFC's loan book grew 16% year-on-year on an asset under management basis.

357.title: Mumbai woman 'books' Dubai trip through fake website, loses ₹4 lakh
357.article_body: A 24-year-old woman from Mumbai's Andheri lost ₹4.08 lakh after booking a fake Dubai tour package through a fraudulent travel website in October, police said. The visas, tickets and hotel stay she had booked through the website also turned out to be fake. The woman had landed on the website while searching for travel websites on Google.

358.title: Pregnant woman denied admission at hospital over Aadhaar card in TN; dies
358.article_body: A 30-year-old woman pregnant with twins allegedly died after she was denied admission at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Tumakuru district. As per neighbours, the doctors at the district hospital refused to admit the woman in labour pain as she didn't have an Aadhaar or Maternity card. She delivered a baby at home and died while delivering the other.

359.title: 35-yr-old shoots neighbour for not involving him in event preparation in Delhi
359.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly shot his neighbour in Delhi for not involving him in the preparations of an event in their locality, police said on Thursday. The victim kept ignoring the accused, who wanted to take part in the preparations for the event. The victim sustained a gunshot injury on his back, said DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary.

360.title: Pic of suspected shooter who tried to assassinate ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan surfaces
360.article_body: Pakistani media has released the picture of the suspected shooter who allegedly tried to assassinate former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan during a rally near Wazirabad. Imran Khan was shot in the leg during the firing and was taken to a hospital in Lahore. Six other people are also said to have been injured in the attack.

361.title: Drugs main reason behind all crimes in Goa: MoS Shripad Naik
361.article_body: Union Minister of State for Tourism Shripad Naik on Thursday said that drug menace is the main reason behind all crimes in Goa. "I support Goa government and Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte in taking action against illegal activities in the tourism sector," Naik said. State government has been drafting various policies to ensure that no illegalities take place, he added.

362.title: Credit Suisse warns of potential profitability drop in Q4
362.article_body: Credit Suisse said the bank's profitability could be hit by a drop in asset management fees in the fourth quarter. Credit Suisse revealed that social media rumours that led to client asset outflows in first two weeks of October contributed to a decrease in assets under management. Last month, Credit Suisse reported a $4 billion loss in the third quarter.

363.title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan waves at his supporters after being shot in leg, video surfaces
363.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan waved at his supporters after being shot in the leg during his rally near Wazirabad. The official Twitter account of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) shared a video of the same and stated that he is in stable condition. He was taken to a hospital in Lahore by road following the attack.

364.title: Imran Khan issues statement after bullet injury, says 'Allah has given me another life'
364.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan, who was shot in his leg in firing during his rally in Pakistan's Wazirabad on Thursday, issued his first statement after the incident. "Allah has given me another life, I will fight back Inshallah," he reportedly said. "He is in a stable condition," Raoof Hasan, a senior aide, was quoted as saying.

365.title: PM should pull up Guj govt over 'sloppy' probe on Morbi tragedy: Kharge
365.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Thursday urged PM Narendra Modi to pull up the Gujarat government to come clean on the "sloppy investigation process" in the Morbi bridge collapse, which claimed over 130 lives. In a tweet, Kharge levelled a series of allegations. "Rusted cable of the bridge was not repaired...contractor was not qualified for the job," he wrote.

366.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad to merge all M&As into parent company ahead of IPO
366.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad filed a merger scheme to consolidate all its mergers and acquisitions in India into One upGrad, in preparation of its initial public offering (IPO) in 2024. The company said that it plans to complete the process by March-June 2023. In the last two-and-a-half years, upGrad has acquired 11 startups and overall acquired 14 companies across different verticals.

367.title: 16 child labourers, including 11 girls, rescued from Karnataka's Udupi
367.article_body: In an operation led by Karnataka's Udupi district administration, 16 minor child labourers, including 11 girls, were rescued from the Malpe port on Thursday, officials said. All the rescued children belong to Koppal and Davanagere districts. The children have been handed over to the Child Welfare Committee (CWC), where rehabilitation arrangements have been made for them, the officials added.

368.title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan waves at his supporters after being shot in leg, video surfaces
368.article_body: Ex-Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan waved at his supporters after being shot in the leg during his rally in Wazirabad. The official Twitter account of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) shared a video, writing, "Imran Khan was shot in the leg but was stable while being taken to hospital. He waived at supporters too." Khan was taken to a hospital in Lahore.

369.title: Pakistan hand SA their 1st defeat in T20 World Cup 2022, stay alive in tournament
369.article_body: Pakistan on Thursday defeated South Africa by 33 runs (DLS method) in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Sydney. With this, South Africa suffered their first defeat in the tournament. Meanwhile, Pakistan jumped to the third position in the Group 2 with four points and stay alive in the tournament.

370.title: 'Dhairya rakhiye,' says Rajnath Singh as people in rally say 'we want PoK'
370.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday asked people to be patient after some of them in a rally in Himachal Pradesh asserted that they want Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). A video has surfaced online in which Singh can be seen smiling and saying, "Dhairya rakhiye," as people say, "PoK chahiye, PoK chaiye (We want PoK)."

371.title: 1 man loses hand, another injured while performing stunts on Mumbai train
371.article_body: Two persons sustained serious injuries while performing stunts on a local train in Mumbai on Monday. One of them lost their right hand while the other suffered head injuries after they fell off the train between Jogeshwari and Andheri railway stations. "We haven't registered any case yet as the men are admitted to a hospital...We'll book them [later]," police said.

372.title: 19-yr-old girl ends life after family beats her boyfriend to death in UP
372.article_body: A 19-year-old girl died by suicide after her family members beat her boyfriend to death in UP. According to the police, the incident took place in the Islampur locality of the Rampur Maniharan region. Local markets remained shut after the incident as the couple belonged to different faiths. A probe is on, said Saharanpur SSP Vipin Tada.

373.title: Over 20,000 schools shut down in India during 2020-21: Education Ministry
373.article_body: More than 20,000 schools were shut down across India during 2020-21, a report launched by the Ministry of Education on Thursday stated. "This decline may be attributed to postponement of admissions due to COVID-19," the report stated. Moreover, the number of teachers also declined by 1.95% in 2021-22 as compared to 2020-21, it added.

374.title: Mamaearth posts ₹19.8 cr net profit in FY22, revenue rises 102% YoY
374.article_body: Skincare and beauty startup Mamaearth posted a net profit of ₹19.8 crore on a standalone basis in the financial year 2021-22 as against a loss of ₹1,332 crore in the previous fiscal. The Gurugram-based firm's revenue grew 102% year-over-year to ₹952 crore in the fiscal, as per the filings with the Registrar of Companies (RoC).

375.title: BJP will win Gujarat elections with big margin: JP Nadda
375.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda on Thursday said his party will win the Gujarat Assembly elections with a big margin under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Nadda made the comments after the Election Commission of India (ECI) announced the schedule for the state election. The election will take place in two phases on December 1 and 5.

376.title: Will raise the issue in proper forum: Bangladesh on Virat Kohli's 'fake fielding'
376.article_body: Bangladesh Cricket Board's cricket operations chairman Jalal Yunus said they will raise the issue of Virat Kohli's alleged fake fielding against Bangladesh in a "proper forum". "We notified...umpire about fake throw but he said he didn't notice it and that's the reason he didn't take review. Shakib Al Hasan also discussed...it and even spoke with umpire after game," Jalal said.

377.title: SRK dances on Chaiyya Chaiyya, cuts b'day cake with fans; video surfaces
377.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan danced to the song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' from his film 'Dil Se' at the SRK Day event, which was organised on his birthday. He also cut his birthday cake with his fans. Several videos and pictures of the event have gone viral on social media platforms. The actor, who will feature in 'Pathaan', turned 57 on Wednesday.

378.title: DPRs to restore 150 lakes in B'luru Urban to be completed by Nov
378.article_body: The detailed project reports (DPR) to restore 150 lakes in Bengaluru Urban will be prepared by the end of this month, an official said. The list of lakes includes 72 lakes in Anekal, 38 in Yelahanka, 15 in Bangalore North, 13 in Bangalore East and 11 in Bangalore South. Already, the DPRs of 74 lakes have been completed.

379.title: Complaint against senior K’taka politicians in B’luru policeman’s death
379.article_body: A police complaint has been filed against senior politicians in Karnataka in the death of KR Puram Police Inspector HL Nandish in Bengaluru. In the complaint filed on November 2, social activist TJ Abraham blamed state ministers Araga Jnanendra, Byrathi Basavaraj and Bengaluru City Police chief CH Pratap Reddy for causing agony to Nandish, resulting in his fatal cardiac arrest.

380.title: Opp Congress launches state-wide protests against Kerala government
380.article_body: The Opposition Congress in Kerala launched state-wide protests against the Left government over their alleged administrative failure and anti-people policies like price-hike. Hundreds of party activists took out protest marches to the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram and to the respective Collectorates in other districts. The march to the Secretariat was led by KPCC chief K Sudhakaran.

381.title: Mangalore Airport to be renamed as 'Mangaluru' Airport: AAI
381.article_body: The Airport Authority of India has issued an official aeronautical information publication (AIP) supplement stating that the Mangalore Airport will be renamed Mangaluru Airport with effect from December 1. The AIP supplement stated that the intent is to officially inform all stakeholders regarding the name change in AIS (Aeronautical Information Services) products.

382.title: BJP distributing liquor, money to voters for Munugode by-polls: BRS
382.article_body: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) leader Dasoju Sravan has accused the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of illegally distributing hundreds of crores of liquor and money to voters for Munugode by-elections. He claimed BRS, earlier called TRS, has asked Telangana Chief Electoral Officer Vikas Raj to look into the matter. Notably, police recently seized liquor bottles from BRS leader Venkat Reddy's residence.

383.title: Not a big deal: Selena Gomez on her viral pic with Hailey Bieber
383.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez has reacted to her picture with Hailey Bieber, which went viral on social media platforms. "It's not a big deal. It's not even a thing," Selena said in a latest interview. Selena and Hailey, amid feud rumours, were seen posing together for the photographers at the 2022 Academy Museum Gala, which was held in October.

384.title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan shot in leg during his rally in Wazirabad: Reports
384.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan was shot in his leg in firing during his rally in Pakistan's Wazirabad on Thursday, as per reports. The firing was reported near the container of Imran Khan. He was transferred from the container to a bulletproof vehicle following the firing, as per reports. At least five other people have also been injured, reports added.

385.title: Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani scout wedding venues in Chandigarh: Report
385.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra and his rumoured girlfriend Kiara Advani are reportedly scouting wedding venues in Chandigarh. As per a source close to Sidharth, the duo contacted The Oberoi Sukhvilas Spa & Resorts, which is the same location where Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa tied the knot. The source added that the rumoured couple dropped the plans of getting married in Goa.

386.title: Rahul Gandhi performs tribal folk dance in Telangana, Cong shares video
386.article_body: During the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was seen performing a traditional folk dance, 'Dhimsa', in Telangana. Gandhi was joined by folk artists and state Congress chief Revanth Reddy during the dance. In another video, the Congress leader was seen whipping himself as part of a local tradition in Telangana.

387.title: Student throws money on dancing classmate, thrashed by teacher; video surfaces
387.article_body: A student was beaten up by a teacher after he threw currency notes on another student who was dancing at a school function in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat. A video of the incident that took place in Alpine Public School has gone viral on social media. The video shows teacher thrashing the student with a stick.

388.title: 2 smuggle 2,112 liquor bottles hiding them between doors, held by Delhi Police
388.article_body: Two persons were arrested in Delhi on Thursday for attempting to smuggle 2,112 bottles of liquor into Bihar by hiding them inside wooden doors, police said. According to the police, the two smugglers were taking the bottles from Delhi to Bihar on a tempo by stacking them inside hollow doors. The bottles were cleverly concealed, a police official said.

389.title: SC dismisses plea to rename Bombay High Court to Maharashtra High Court
389.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a plea to rename the Bombay High Court to Maharashtra High Court. The plea was filed by a former judge VP Patil who had served as a judge for 26 years. "These are issues for lawmakers to decide. What fundamental right is prejudiced for you to bring it here?" SC said.

390.title: KCR is PM Modi's copy in terms of attitude, thoughts: Rahul
390.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao is "a copy" of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in terms of attitude and thoughts. Furthermore, he said that Rao supported BJP in every bill in the Parliament. Currently, Rahul Gandhi is in Telangana for the Congress party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra.

391.title: Central Railway ticket checkers collect ₹1 cr fine each from violators
391.article_body: Central Railway's four ticket checkers in Mumbai Division collected around ₹1 crore each in the current financial year from 53,697 ticketless travellers, an official said. One of the train ticket inspectors caught 15,053 violators and collected ₹1.43 crore fine. Another caught 14,837 ticketless travellers and levied a fine of ₹1.34 crore. The two others collected around ₹1.03 crore fine each.

392.title: Example of BJP's misgovernance in Guj: Owaisi on Morbi bridge collapse
392.article_body: Following the Morbi bridge collapse incident in Gujarat, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday said what happened in Morbi is unfortunate and gives an example of BJP’s "misgovernance" in the state. Furthermore, he said, "Due to the misgovernance of BJP in Gujarat, many people lost lives during COVID-19. There is inflation and businesses have been affected."

393.title: Cannot go on any bridge now: Morbi bridge tragedy survivor
393.article_body: A survivor of the Morbi suspension bridge tragedy, in which over 135 people were killed, said that he gets scared every time he looks at the bridge. "I don't think I can go on any bridge now," the survivor said adding that the Morbi bridge was his favourite hangout spot, and he regularly visited it for several years.

394.title: Traffic disrupted as oil spilled on Sinhagad Road in Pune
394.article_body: Traffic was briefly disrupted after an unidentified vehicle reportedly spilled oil on Sinhagad Road between Pune's Panmala and Rajaram Bridge on Thursday morning. A fire brigade team rushed to the spot and threw sand and dust on the road to prevent accidents. Fire brigade officials claimed that they were unaware of how oil had spilled onto the road.

395.title: GIC, ESR establish $600 mn JV in India for industrial, logistics assets
395.article_body: GIC and ESR Group have set up a joint venture (JV) worth $600 million to buy profit-making industrial and logistics assets in India. The companies said the JV will invest in "stabilised operational assets" in tier 1 and tier 2 cities of the country. The JV is an extension of an existing partnership between the entities in the country.

396.title: When we got engaged, people said he's marrying an aunty: Kapil Dev's wife
396.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Kapil Dev's wife Romi Dev told Sonakshi Sinha and Huma Qureshi that they've lived her life in their film 'Double XL'. Talking about the film and its subject, Romi recalled being body-shamed and how when she got engaged to Kapil Dev, people said he was marrying an aunty. She said she "loved every minute" of the film.

397.title: Indian bowlers got smashed vs Bangladesh, this is a wake-up call: Raina
397.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina said the Indian bowling attack got "smashed around" during their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh, adding that it was a "learning curve" for them. "We might have won but even Rohit Sharma admitted...that Bangladesh were better than India. This is a wake-up call," added Raina. "The match was in Bangladesh's favour," he stated.

398.title: Shinde govt formed to serve Guj instead of Maha: NCP's Jayant Patil
398.article_body: NCP leader Jayant Patil on Thursday criticised the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government over the loss of big industrial projects and accused it of "serving Gujarat". "Projects are being shifted to Gujarat and the CM and Deputy CM are mute spectators," Patil said. "Conspiracy was hatched to bring a new government...so that the...government would serve Gujarat more than Maharashtra," he added.

399.title: Mumbai man cheated of ₹50 lakh by HK woman posing as crypto analyst
399.article_body: A Mumbai man has filed a police complaint after being allegedly defrauded of ₹50.40 lakh by a Hong Kong-based woman. The woman, who allegedly posed as a cryptocurrency analyst at JP Morgan, Hong Kong, befriended the man on WhatsApp earlier this year. The woman persuaded him to invest in a crypto coin of the People's Bank of China.

400.title: Boeing could generate $100 bn in revenue annually by 2025: CEO
400.article_body: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun said the US planemaker could generate $100 billion in revenue annually by 2025. Boeing last recorded $100 billion in revenue in 2018. In its first public investor meeting since 2016, Boeing said it expects to deliver 800 commercial jets at least by 2025, pegging the MAX and 787 production per month at 50 and 10, respectively.
